Sharḥ Qānūn al-Shaykh Ibn Sīnā lil-Shaykh al-ʻAllāmah Muḥammad ibn Maḥmūd al-Āmulī
Sharḥ al-Qānūn fī al-ṭibb
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Āmulī, Muḥammad ibn Maḥmūd , -1352 or 1353
oai_dc:dc.dc:publisher: Houghton Library, Harvard University Houghton Library, Harvard University Houghton Library, Harvard University Houghton Library, Harvard University Houghton Library, Harvard University Houghton Library, Harvard University Houghton Library, Harvard University Houghton Library, Harvard University Houghton Library, Harvard University Houghton Library, Harvard University
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Title from illuminated headpiece on f. 1v.
Written in one column, 27 lines per page, in black, framed within double golden and blue lines.
بسم الله الرحمن الرحيم الحمد لله الذي دقت حكمته في خلفة الانسان وعمت نعمته عليهم من فرط الاحسان... :Incipit
According to the last paragraph (ff. 525r-525v), writing of the book was completed in mid-Muḥarram 753 AH [beginning of March 1352 AD]. The copy is not dated but possibly from 16th century.
According to a note on f. 1r, copied in the hand of the author himself.
There are several illegible ownership statements and seals on fol. 1r dated from 1032 AH [1622 or 23 AD] to 1232 AH [1817 AD].
MS Arab SM4275. Houghton Library, Harvard University.
